channel.title: RP Excerpts - Analysis
channel.description:
Greetings.
Have you ever typed in any of these and wonder why the GM misinterprets your action or you just... miss terribly.
I slash at the beast. I kapow the opponent. I fire fireball at the enemy.
Here's a little guide to spice things up. Have you guys ever... tried being a tad bit more specific?
_No, I'm not asking you to describe eastern training manuals in full detail, step by step. At least state the action that your character is going to take._
For example... Elise had her staff on the ready; she held the staff with two hands, her left hand lower than her right hand, pointing the stick at the ground. Her body tensed up, ready for combat, her eyes fixed on her opponent. This was an honorable duel, and nothing less could waver her concentration at this moment. Her eyes blazed with a passion unlike the demure lady she was; for she had to win. She put all her weight on her left leg, before pushing out, dashing towards her opponent... using her right hand to smash the staff downwards on her foe.
So... _Type in a paragraph or two. I'll be the judge. Major RPers can also write in to give more examples for people to follow._

item.title: RP Excerpts - Analysis
item.dc:creator: Damafaud
item.description:
For combat, short, concise sentences are better.

“DIE!”
Faris tackled Drevis. He put all of his weight behind him. Nothing mattered anymore. Elle Cliff was not named a cliff for nothing.

They had a fall. A long, long fall.

item.title: RP Excerpts - Analysis
item.dc:creator: MaximusPrime
item.description:
i was gone when this happened but this is interesting

i tend to try not to put too much information bc i’m afraid that it’ll be too boring/overwhelm the reader, so i might give a general description of what they’re doing or will do but not go into as much detail as this

Shurian:

Elise had her staff on the ready; she held the staff with two hands, her left hand lower than her right hand, pointing the stick at the ground. Her body tensed up, ready for combat, her eyes fixed on her opponent. This was an honorable duel, and nothing less could waver her concentration at this moment. Her eyes blazed with a passion unlike the demure lady she was; for she had to win. She put all her weight on her left leg, before pushing out, dashing towards her opponent… using her right hand to smash the staff downwards on her foe.

like i might say she shifts her weight or just smashes her staff downwards instead of being ultra specific like this

Read full topic

item.title: RP Excerpts - Analysis
item.dc:creator: James
item.description:
Jura broke into a run, stopping besides Suzuha. “What— what happened?” He gasped. He reached down to feel her neck, felt the pounding life beating, and felt relief. He slapped Suzuha on the cheek, non too gently, before shaking her violently. “Wake up!” he shouted. “Help me!” he screamed hoarsely, before sinking to his knees.

item.title: RP Excerpts - Analysis
item.dc:creator: Shurian
item.description:
Read.

Shurian:

You play a character named Jura. He has a childhood friend, named Suzuha. They aren’t exactly on the best of terms, but they’ve made do. Suzuha has always been a fun-loving woman, that gets on Jura’s nerves all the time. She always is cheerful, without a care in the world. Or at least, that’s how Jura always saw her. She lives next door… And one day, as you were about to go out, you see her by your porch, half-conscious.

Follow this. Read. You don’t know her?

Also, there is no blood. Wonder where you got that from.

Read full topic

item.title: RP Excerpts - Analysis
item.dc:creator: Magnus
item.description:
(Oh It makes sense now)

I saw the woman collapse. I didn’t know her, but that wasn’t the point. “Holy crap,” i muttered under my breath. She obviously wasn’t well. I ran towards her, but glanced inside the open door and felt cold. I half carried the woman away from the open door, away from the boy on the ground in a growing pool of blood. I wasn’t a detective. It wasn’t my job to get my hands stained red.
“What happened?” I asked the woman, but she was too busy sobbing to answer.

@shurian
Is more required or no?

Read full topic

item.title: RP Excerpts - Analysis
item.dc:creator: Shurian
item.description:
Everyone who sees this. Write a response to this. A winner will be selected, who will help design one of the antagonist for the RP Academy! And you get a cookie.

(Those who are already in the RP will get to have a sneak peek on one of the antagonists already in the list.)

You play a character named Jura. He has a childhood friend, named Suzuha. They aren’t exactly on the best of terms, but they’ve made do. Suzuha has always been a fun-loving woman, that gets on Jura’s nerves all the time. She always is cheerful, without a care in the world. Or at least, that’s how Jura always saw her. She lives next door… And one day, as you were about to go out, you see her by your porch, half-conscious.

The streets were dimly lit. The atmosphere was heavy, and the woman grit her teeth. Each step was heavy, and her vision was blurring. She, with hurried breathing, turned the corner, and stepped onto her porch. She attempted to open the door, but the door was already open.? There, was Jura… She didn’t want to see him, but her headache was killing her, and she fell to the ground, the world spinning around her. Every fibre of her being was burning, and she weakly protested…
“No…”

You are free to make AND state your assumptions as you go along. State all your assumptions before you write your excerpt.

Read full topic

item.title: RP Excerpts - Analysis
item.dc:creator: Shurian
item.description:
About showing character emotions

Think of your character, what kind of character they are:
If the character is a laid back, carefree person without a real care in the world, he won’t be like “Yeah… I do understand your plight, and thus I shall grant you your freedom. Use it wisely.” He would more be “I’m letting you go, 'cause I feel like it, so go, Shoo!”

Read full topic
